p:
For our estimates, we consider the (up to) 100 most recent survey responses per region on April 20. The date is chosen because the mean period between illness onset and a 95% confidence of IgG antibodies presence is 14 days ( 16). This results in n = 999 responses (59 ± 35 per region) across Spanish regions, with a cumulative reach of
∑
i
r
i
= 67 , 199
(0.1827 ± 0.0701% of the regional population, and 0.1434% of the national population). On average, participants provide information for r
i = 74.6219 ± 38.0291 members in their social circle, which is coherent with Dunbar's acquaintance group and related studies that take social networks into consideration ( 17). Within this dataset, our outlier removal methods excluded 19.8883 ± 9.2692% of responses, including spurious contributions as the original average reach per participant before filtering was >5 · 10 15.
